com.autonomy.aci.client.transport

Interface EncryptionCodec

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractEncryptionCodec

    public interface EncryptionCodec
extends Serializable
    IDOL Server supports a number of different methods for encrypting ACI actions between itself and the client. This interface defines the methods that the AciHttpClient will call to encrypt and decrypt an ACI action.

    Classes that implement this interface should be aware of just how IDOL expects the incoming ACI action to be formatted. If the user is sending a query, for example, the action parameters sent may look something like: 

       action=query&text=tour%20de%20france&maxresults=10&combine=simple&print=all
    When the AciHttpClient detects that an EncryptionCodec should be used, it creates a new set of ACI parameters and uses the output of the codec as the value to one of those parameters.

    When using a Cipher to encrypt text, the result is a byte[] not a string. HTTP is a text based protocol, so the EncryptionCodec needs to convert the byte[] to a String by Base64 encoding it. Furthermore, as query strings can be quite long, even before encrypting. Thus the query string that is sent to IDOL will look it: 

       action=encrypted&data=<base64(encrypt(deflate(original query string)))>
    When IDOL sends the response back, the AciHttpClient takes the contents of the /autnresponse/responsedata/autn:encrypted element and applies the steps to encrypt in reverse, i.e. base64 decode, decrypt and inflate. This will then result in a byte[] that contains the actual ACI response to be sent back via the AciService.

    The reason the codec works with byte arrays and not Strings, is due to IDOL Server having a number of actions that return binary data, i.e. action=ClusterServe2DMap. There is a utility class EncryptionCodecUtils that has methods to make it easier to encrypt/decrypt String objects.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte[] decrypt(byte[] bytes)
      This method should firstly Base64 decode bytes, then decrypt it and finally inflate it.
      byte[] encrypt(byte[] bytes)
      This method should firstly deflate bytes, then encrypt it and finally Base64 encode it.

    • Method Detail

      • encrypt

        byte[] encrypt(byte[] bytes)
               throws EncryptionCodecException
        This method should firstly deflate bytes, then encrypt it and finally Base64 encode it.
        Parameters:
        bytes - An array of bytes to encrypt.
        Returns:
        A Base64 encoded, encrypted, deflated copy of the input array.
        Throws:
        EncryptionCodecException - if there was a problem during any of the three stages of processing.

      • decrypt

        byte[] decrypt(byte[] bytes)
               throws EncryptionCodecException
        This method should firstly Base64 decode bytes, then decrypt it and finally inflate it.
        Parameters:
        bytes - A Base64 encoded, encrypted and deflated array of bytes.
        Returns:
        The original unencrypted content as a byte array.
        Throws:
        EncryptionCodecException - if there was a problem during any of the three stages of processing.
